metadata.title: CVE-2024-44944 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: ctnetlink: use helper function to calculate expect IDDelete expectation path is missing a call to the nf_expect_get_id()helper function to calculate the expectation ID, otherwise LSB of theexpectation object address is leaked to userspace.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-44944` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-lowlatency - 4.15.0-232.244
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-200-generic - 5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-232.244').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-200.220~18.04.1').
